ovdesc.p: Holds the history for the DX.TRANSACTION table.

desc.p: Total of variation margin figures consolidated back to customer reference currency. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE.
Up to 19 characters
Holds the nominal amount that needs to be blocked or unblocked.
Represents the type of settlement performed in this transaction.
Its value is defaulted from TYPE of DX.CLOSEOUT application.
Valid values are SETTLEMENT, MATURITY, EXERCISE, EXPIRY or ASSIGNMENT.
Limit amount originally available against this limit, see LIMIT.REFERENCE
No Input Field - defaulted from LIMIT
Type of commission/charge. Forms multivaluedset through to COMM.TAX, Possible values COMMISSION_EXECUTION_CLEARING_REGULATORY_MISC_AUTOMATIC
Updated by DX.TRADE
Up to 10 characters
Amount of tax calculated in commission currency. Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 19 characters in AMT format
Used for Exotic Options processing.
Holds values YES or NO.
Is part of the list of user defined fields or parameter that defines the uniqueness of the exotic position.
This defines which of these fields are parts of the position and price keys.
Holds values YES or NO.
Event causing posting of premium - will either be single-valued DXTRA id if premium posted up-front, or single or multivalued closeout ID if premium posted at closeout time.
35 Alpha
Profit ans loss (variation margin) figure generated for a position. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE. Split by currency of variation margin/P&L produced.
Up to 19 characters
Not in use.
Trading constraint ID. Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 17 characters, input must be a valid record on the DX.TRADING.CONSTRAINT
Tax Amount in trade currency.
Account which the Profit and loss (variation margin) is posted to.
19, Alpha
Its value is populated from DX.STRATEGY.
A different strategy can be used for each side of the trade in the PRI.STRATEGY and SEC.STRATEGY fields.
When transactions with a strategy are found as part of the revaluation process, the corresponding trades are valued together using the margin routine, if specified, in the DX.STRATEGY record.
It is used for reporting purposes.
Used for Exotic Options processing.
Holds the exotic option amount.
Specifies the price at which the trade is being done
No input field
Upto 19 numeric values
Set to YES if a transfer advice is to be produced else set to NO
No input field
Upto 3 alphanumeric values
Valid inputs are either YES or NO
Exchange rate between trade currency and customer accountcurrency. Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 19 characters in AMT format
Not in use.
This field is obsolete.
The Tax Type applied to this side of the deal.
Used for Exotic Options processing.
Holds the value date for account posting.
The TRANS.NAME is different depending on the application e.g. DX.TRADE-FUTURE_OPTION
Up to 10 characters
Regions are used to represent exchanges for the purpose of defining trading calendars in the HOLIDAY application.
It denotes the initial margin currency of the account of the customer.
Number of lots active on this transaction at last reval time.
19 Numeric
Holds the DX Revalue key.
A date field to define when the period of caplet/ floor ends.

Counterparty (the 'other customer' on the trade). Updated by DX.TRADE. May be multivalued in the case where the transaction is for the secondary customer and there is more than one customer on the primary side.
Up to 10 characters, input must be a valid record on the CUSTOMER Application
Represents the Unrealised Profit and Loss currency on this transaction.
The trade currency updated by DX.TRADE
3 Alpha
Sub asset type of contract traded. Updated by DX.TRADE
Linked to SUB.ASSET.TYPE
5 Alpha
This is the sequence number of the Periodic Interest Table for a Sell floating rate. The format is XXYYY where XX is the sequence no and YYY is the currency.
Represents the price in T24 internal format.
This is the total cost of the DX .TRADE expressed in trade currency equivalent.
The total cost is ideally equal to (Lots * Int. Price) +/- (Commissions and Charges)
No input field
Status of customer in terms of segregated/non-segregated business.
Up to 15 characters
The DEALER id for this transaction.
Price/Premium as input, with number of decimal places standardised to price d.p.'s
Up to 19 characters
Valid values are OPEN and CLOSE.
This specifies the open or close status of the transaction.
This is used in the new average price method OPENING.
Holds the closeout keys that are pending to closeout for the customer.
Currency for variation margin. Multivalue set with VARIATION.MARGIN. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE.
Up to 3 characters, input must be a valid record on the CURRENCY Application
Code(s) on DX.EVENT.TYPE representing the type of transaction generated. Links through to TRANSACTION type and CATEGORY codes as necessary.
Each transaction may include one or more events, i.e. futures trade entry may include OP (Opening position) and CS (Commission charged).
Up to 6 characters, input must be a valid record on the DX.EVENT.TYPE Application
Total of initial margin figures consolidated back to customer reference currency. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE.
Up to 19 characters
Exchange rate between customer reference and trade currency. Updated by DX.TRADE
Up to 19 characters in AMT format
Profit and loss (variation margin) figure generated for a position.Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE. Split by currency of variation margin/P&L produced.
19, Amt
Contract code associated with this transaction.
Up to 12 characters, input must be a valid record on the DX.CONTRACT.MASTER Application
The value date of the closeouts affecting this transaction based on the TRADE.DATE + TX.CO.OFFSET.
Holds the DX Revalue key.
Represents the type of settlement performed in this transaction.
Its value is defaulted from TYPE of DX.CLOSEOUT application.
Valid values are SETTLEMENT, MATURITY, EXERCISE, EXPIRY or ASSIGNMENT.
Date of activity
Up to 8 characters in Date format
Represents the Unrealised Profit and Loss currency on this transaction.
Used for Exotic Options processing.
Identifies the currency of the account in which accounting entries have to be passed.
Links revaluation DX.TRANSACTION records to the original online DX.TRANSACTION record
No Input Field - system generated
Represents the premium payment offset for this transaction.
No of days offset from charging to account posting for premiums for the customer.
The number of lots traded prior to any closeout or corporate action taking place.
The Tax Code for this side of the deal.
This is a key to a record on the TXN.TAX.CODE table.
A date field to define when the settlement payment occurs for this period.
Holds Current Variation Margin Amount in Local Currency
Currency for inital margin. Multivalue set with INITAL.MARGIN. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE.
Up to 3 characters, input must be a valid record on the CURRENCY Application
Specifies the receiver bank address.
This is the rate to be added to or subtracted from the reference rate.
Represents the number of lots settled for this transaction.
Number of units of measure per trading lot. Updated by DX.TRADE
17, Alpha
Specifies the receiver counterparty.
Should be valid record in CUSTOMER.
Holds a valid record id of INTEREST.DAY.BASIS.
This is the sequence number of the Periodic Interest Table for Buy floating rate. The format is XXYYY where XX is the sequence no and YYY is the currency.
The statement numbers that are generated in this transaction after settlement.
Holds the key to the STMT.ENTRY file.
This is the identification code, known as the Limit Reference used in the LIMIT key and in LIMIT.PARAMETER to define how a LIMIT is defaulted.
Holds a valid Reference ID.
Time of transaction update.
Up to 5 characters in TIME format
Date of fixing the period date.
Total of initial margin figures consilidated back to customer referency currency. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE
19, Amt
Holds the DX Revalue id.
Up to 35 characters
Date of reversal of source application record, or replacement with newer version.
Up to 11 characters in DATE format
Null unless parent transaction is reversed or adjusted
Internal format strike price for option transaction. Only updated by DX.TRADE when trade type is OPTIONs. Held in the standard internal T24
Format.
Up to 19 characters
It represents the trade date.
In case of closeout it holds the transaction date.
Set to YES if fee is required else set to NO
No input field
Upto 3 alphanumeric values
Valid inputs are either YES or NO
A date field to define when the premium for this period is to be paid.
Denotes the number of lots that is settled.
Commission amount in commission currency. Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 19 characters in AMT format
Inital margin figure generated for a position. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE. Split by currency of initial margin.
19, Amt
Should be a valid record in DX.REVALUE.SUMMARY.
Represents the Unrealised option account.
If a hedge transaction, to what instrument is the transaction linked.
Up to 35 characters
Not in use.
Its value should be a valid record in CURRENCY.
It denotes the initial margin currency of the account of the customer.
Identifies the Customer with whom the trade is made.
Its value should be a valid record in CUSTOMER application.
The exchange rate used for the calculation of charges and commissions for the external customer or broker.
Not in use.
The rate of exchange between the two currencies (initial margin currency and the local currency) for initial margin posting.
Number of active lots remaining on transaction.
Up to 19 characters
Holds values YES or NO.
It denotes whether the exotic event deciding the existence of the option has happened or not.
Not in use.
Holds the current system date.
Strike price as input, with number of decimal places standardised to price d.p's. Only for OPTIONs. Required in case input strike needs to be sent to third party application.
Up to 19 characters
Represents the Unrealised option account.
Settlement value (P&L) generated in account currency. Only updated by DX.CO.PROCESS
19 Numeric
Number of lots settled in this transaction. Only updated by DX.CO.PROCESS.
Up to 19 characters
This field holds the Price of DX. TRADE prevailing before Corporate action happens for the first time
No input field
Commission amount.
Up to 19 characters in AMT format
The rate of exchange between the two currencies (variation margin currency and the local currency) for variation margin posting.
Not in use.
Represents the delivery messages to be produced.
Commission code-'OVERRIDE' for fully nanual, 'AUTO'(defaulted by DX.GET.COMMISSION) for full automatic processing or FT.COMMISSION/CHARGE.TYPE ID for semi-automatic.
Up to 20 characters
Represents the number of lots that are pending to closeout.
Position type. Updated by DX.TRADE
2, Alpha
This field is obsolete.
Internal format trade price/premium for this transaction. Trade ccy. Premium for trades. Quoted as standard T24 internal price.
Up to 19 characters
Is this transaction authorised
Up to 4 characters
Used for Exotic Options processing.
The field holds a list of user defined fields/parameter that defines the uniqueness of the exotic position.
System time stamp on reversal or amendment of parent transaction.
Up to 5 character in TIME format
Null unless parent transaction is reversed or adjusted
The date in which the transaction is performed.
Account to post commission to. Updated by DX.TRADE
Up to 16 characters
Specifies the external recipient customer portfolio reference if any
No input field
Upto 18 alphanumeric values
Option contract call or put flag. CALL_PUT. Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 4 characters, input must be either CALL/PUT
Actual date of transaction update.
Up to 11 characters in DATE format
Holds the sub-account information.
Holds the details of Block ids when more than one transaction is closed out through various closeout methods.
Used for NON-STOP (NS) product.
Shows the value LIVE if the TRANS.DATE is less than or equal to today
Shows the vlaue FWD if the TRANS.DATE is greater than today
No Input Field - defaulted from DX.TRADE
Represents the amount Unrealised Profit and Loss calculated for the customer on this transaction.
Updated after a DX valuation has taken place.
The premium payment amount in the contract currency.
Used for Exotic Options processing.
Holds the rate of exchange between the two currencies.
ID of Source transaction.
35 Alpha
The Last Date by which a customer may exercise an option. The exercise date (European Options) or last exercise date (American Options) for this
contract.
This field will default to date calculated from Date formula for Dec.Date on DX.CONTRACT.MASTER, but this can be overriden as required.
Up to 9 type D date format characters.
Mandatory Input if CONTRACT.TYPE is OPTION
The product category.
Up to 6 characters, input must be a valid record on the CATEGORY Application
Account to post the variation margin.
16, Alpha
Holds the message number associated to the activity.
ID of source transaction. Define concat field based on this field
Portfolio or customer id for this transaction.
Must be a valid record on DX.CUSTOMER or SEC.ACC.MASTER
Holds the exchange rate in which conversion has to take place based on the definition in DX.PARAMETER.
Specifies the number of lots to be transferred.
It is a valid category code.
Was this transaction created from the primary side of the trade.
3, Alpha
YES_NO
Used for Exotic Options processing.
The exotic amount that needs to be posted.
Used for Exotic Options processing.
This field holds a list of user defined fields/parameter values that define the uniqueness of the exotic position.
This field holds the own book portfolio to which this portfolio belongs.
Identifies whether the transaction is a own book transaction or not.
Not in use.
Delivery message ref returned from EB.HANDOFF
Up to 16 characters
A date field to define when the period of caplet/floor starts.
Used for Exotic Options processing.
Identifies the account, over which financial entries relating to the transaction are to be passed.
Specifies the external recipient customer reference number
No input field
Upto 10 numeric values
Must be a valid record in CUSTOMER application
The key to any entitlements currently affecting the transaction.
Should be a valid record in DX.ENTITLEMENT.
The carriers that are allowed to be used for the delivery messages generated by this deal.
Currency for initial margin. Multivalue set with INITIAL.MARGIN. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE
3, CCY
Linked to CURRENCY.
Holds the id of DX.REP.POS.LAST.
This links to the last time that position was updated.
Specifies the receiver bank name.
Represents the frequency in which the premium payment is to be made.
Not in use.
Not in use.
Date message produced or 'NOT PRODUCED' if not produced yet.
Up to 8 characters in DATE format
Date of application of commission/charges/premium.
Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 10 characters, input must be either: TRADE/SETTLEMENT
Currency of commission type. Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 3 characters in CURRENCY format
Type of option from the drop down menu 'CALL' or 'PUT'
CALL: Confers upon the holder the right, but not obligation, to BUY stock at a fixed price at a future date
PUT: Confers upon the holder the right, but not obligation, to SELL stock at a fixed price at a future date
No Input Field - defaulted from DX.TRADE
Used for Exotic Options processing.
Holds a list of user defined fields/parameter that define the uniqueness of the exotic position.
Currency for unrealised option value. Multivalue set with PREV.UNPL. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE.
3, CCY
Linked to CURRENCY
The date of closeout affecting the transaction.
Represents the amount Unrealised Profit and Loss calculated for the customer on this transaction.
Updated after a DX valuation has taken place.
Total of variation margin figures consolidated back to customer reference currency. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE.
19, Amt
For revaluation this field represents the reference/reporting currency of the client.
Up to 3 characters in CCY format
Holds the department or account officer ID.
Should be a valid record in DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER.
Should be a valid record in DX.DIARY.
Represents the estimated initial margin amount for the transaction.
Used for Exotic Options processing.
Holds the exotic option currency.
Tax amount in account currency.
Customer type. Initally updated by DX.TRADE
Up to 15 characters
Number of days charge off-set between earning and posting.
Up to 3 characters
Denotes whether the underlying is a CAP or FLOOR.
Amount of premium posted per event in PREM.POST.TXN
19, Amt
This is the key to this DX.TRANSACTION record
Is this a hedge or speculative trade transaction.
Up to 15 characters, input must be HEDGE/TRADE
Represents the pending statement entries that need to be raised.
Specifies the recipient customer or portfolio.
Should be valid record in CUSTOMER.
Accounting STMT numbers. Updated by DX.CALL.ACCOUNTING in DX.TRANS.UPDATE.
Up to 29 characters
NO INPUT
Account to post Initial Margin.
16, Alpha
Are close-outs allowed for the leg of the trrade represented by the transaction record.
Up to 3 characters, input must be either: YES/NO
Represents the price for the number of lots traded.
The name of the Exchange where the applicable contract is traded.
Specifies the receiver bank sort code.
Not in use.
Not in use.
The rate of exchange between the two currencies (variation margin currency and the local currency) for variation margin posting.
The total number of lots being closed out by this closeout.
Updated by DX.CO.PROCESS.
Acount which the Initial margin figure generated for a position is posted to. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE. Split by currency of initial margin.
19,Alpha
The delivery period or prompt date of the contract transacted.
Currency market. Updated by DX.TRADE
1 Numeric
Linked to CURRENCY
Not in use.
Currency of commission posting account. Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 3 characters in CCY format
Settlement value (P&L) generated in reference currency. Only updated by DX.CO.PROCESS
Up to 19 characters
Contract buy or sell flag BUY_SELL updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 4 characters, input must be either BUY/SELL
Not in use.
Not in use.
Total of variation margin figures consolidated back to customer reference currency. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE.
Up to 19 characters
The rate of exchange between the two currencies (initial margin currency and the local currency) for initial margin posting.
Original number of lots for this transaction.
Up to 19 characters
The rate of exchange between the two currencies (variation margin currency and the local currency) for variation margin posting.
Free text reference/narrative field mapped from either the PRI.CUS.REF or SEC.CUST.REF on the corresponding DX.TRADE.
Up to 16 characters
Initial margin figure generated for a position. Only updated by DX.RUN.REVALUE. Split by currency of initial margin
Up to 19 characters
Customer account currency Updated by DX.TRADE.
Up to 3 characters in CCY format
Identifies the account, over which financial entries relating to the transaction are to be passed.
DX.EVENT.TYPE code linked to EB.ACTIVITY code
Up to 4 characters
Input must be a valid record on the DX.EVENT.TYPE
EB.ACTIVITY code used to generate message format "NNNN" i.e 4 digit sequence number.
Up to 4 characters
Input must be a valid record on the EB.ACTIVITY Application
Holds the settlement account provided at trade level.
Holds the currency of the settlement account updated to CASH.PAYOUT.ACC.
The payout amount to be paid / received from customer in the CASH.PAYOUT.CCY.
The FX.PAYOUT.CCY in trade is mapped.
Holds the STRIKE.QUOTE.CCY given at trade level.
Holds the STRIKE.QUOTE given at trad level.
Date on which the Mark-to-Market (MTM) is posted.
Currency in which the MTM is posted.
Mark-to-Market (MTM) amount posted in MTM.CCY on MTM.DATE.
Account in which the Mark-to-Market (MTM) is posted.
MTM amount in local currency equivalent.
Exchange rate between account currency and local currency.
The previously posted Mark-to-Market (MTM) date
The previously posted Mark-to-Market (MTM) account currency.
The previously posted Mark-to-Market (MTM) amount.
The previously posted Mark-to-Market (MTM) account.
The previously posted Mark-to-Market (MTM) amount in local currency.
Exchange rate between account currency and local currency for the previously posted MTM.
Flag indicator to reverse the MTM amount on reversal or closeout of the contract.
Tax type considered for tax posting.
Tax code defined at TAX.TYPE.CONDITION for the tax calculation.
Percentage of tax that is applied on tax base amount.
Tax base amount in terms of EUR currrency on which the tax percentage is applied.
Tax amount in account currency of the transaction.
Tax amount in local currency.
Tax currency which is EUR.
Tax amount in EUR.
Exchange rate between trade currency and local currency.
Lots in terms of trade currency of the transaction.
